Camera Processing¶

class camera_processing.EventTracker(x_pos=0, y_pos=0)[source]¶

Event tracking object.

A class to classify and maintain the events detected from the frames passed to it.

Attributes:
x_pos (float) : The x position of the current frame. y_pos (float) : The y position of the current frame. event (str) : The current event that has been classified.
calc_dist2(x_pos, y_pos)[source]¶

Calculate the squared euclidean distance.

Calculates the squared euclidean distance between the current position and the new position passed.

Args:
x_pos (float): x position of the point to be measured. y_pos (float): y position of the point to be measured.
Returns:
The squared distance between the two points.
event = None¶

A string of the current event

significant_movement(x_pos, y_pos, threshold=10)[source]¶

Determines if movement is ‘significant’.

Measures to see if the distance between the current position and (x_pos, y_pos) is greater than threshold.

Args:
x_pos (float): x position of the point to be measured. y_pos (float): y position of the point to be measured. threshold (float, optional): The distance that is considered ‘significant’. Defaults to 10.
Returns:
Bool: True if distance is greater than threshold, False otherwise.
update(frame, bounding_box)[source]¶

Updates the tracking.

Takes the next frame along with a bounding box of the object, and updates the event.

Args:
frame: An opencv image of the next frame bounding_box: A tuple that describes the box ie. (top_left_x_pos, top_left_y_pos, top_right_x_pos, bottom_left_y_pos).
Returns:
None.
x_pos = None¶

The center x position of the tracked object

y_pos = None¶

The center y position of the tracked object

class camera_processing.Tracker[source]¶

Tracks an object when given a ROI (Region Of Interest).

Tracks a ROI, using the KCF (Kernelized Correlation Filters) tracking algorithm, until tracking is lost.

initKCFTracking(frame, bounding_box)[source]¶

Creates a default KCF tracking object.

kcfTracking(frame)[source]¶

Progresses the object tracking.

Takes a frame and attempts to track the original object using KCF tracking.

Args:
frame: The opencv image to be tracked.
Returns:
If tracking was successful returns the frame with a box draw on it, otherwise return the frame as is.
track(frame, bounding_box=None)[source]¶

Decides if tracking should be done.

Args:
frame: The opencv image to be tracked. bounding_box: The ROI to track, only needed if this is the first time calling track. Defaults to None.
